solution_line_template: Since a dozen is equal to {eggs_per_dozen}, then {num_dozens} dozen eggs are equal to {eggs_per_dozen} x {num_dozens} = <<{num_dozens}*{eggs_per_dozen}={total_eggs}>>{total_eggs} eggs.
Tricia will use {total_eggs} x {crepe_fraction} = <<{total_eggs}*{crepe_fraction}={eggs_for_crepes}>>{eggs_for_crepes} eggs for making crepes.
{remaining_eggs_after_crepes} x {cupcake_fraction} = <<{remaining_eggs_after_crepes}*{cupcake_fraction}={eggs_for_cupcakes}>>{eggs_for_cupcakes} eggs will be used for making cupcakes.

Thus, there are only {remaining_eggs_after_crepes} - {eggs_for_cupcakes} = <<{remaining_eggs_after_crepes}-{eggs_for_cupcakes}={eggs_left_for_breakfast}>>{eggs_left_for_breakfast} eggs left to make sunny-side-up eggs for breakfast.
